revised_title: Observations of a Comet in Valparaiso
tldr: In this article, Captain Basil Hall shares his observations of a comet seen in Valparaiso in April and May 1821. He and his team used a wire micrometer to measure the comet's right ascensions and declinations. They also measured the angular distance of the comet from Aldebaran, Sirius, and Canopus. The comet's appearance and behavior were documented, including its color, tail length, and orientation.
